snippet: Starting on Wednesday, visitors can see the shuttle in a pavilion that replaced one shredded by Hurricane Sandy, but the Enterprise lacks a permanent home.
abstract: Space shuttle Enterprise, eight months after Hurricane Sandy left it damaged and unprotected, will have a new, temporary, home at Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum;  officials of museum, World War II-era aircraft carrier docked at Midtown Manhattan, want to construct an annex on land to house the shuttle, across the West Side Highway.
lead_paragraph: Starting on Wednesday, visitors can see the shuttle in a pavilion that replaced one shredded by Hurricane Sandy, but the Enterprise lacks a permanent home.

headline.main: Shuttle Enterprise Exhibit to Reopen in New Temporary Home
headline.print_headline: Enterprise Back on Display, but Its Home Is Temporary
